text: Do you follow a standard for wrapping long lines in source code?
What line length do you find most comfortable to read?
Sometimes I find people who program on wide-screen monitors and like to use its full width for displaying source code.
I prefer shorter lines, around 80-100 characters, but I have a hard time trying to convince colleagues with the ever-increasing popularity of wide-screen devices.
When writing code do you wrap text or not?
Is there a valid reason for enforcing a maximum width of 80 characters in a code file, this day and age?
